title: Hundreds missing as China ship sinks
desc: Five people are dead and hundreds are missing after a cruise ship with more than 450 people mostly elderly tourists capsizes on China's Yangtze River.

title: Urgent Greek debt crisis talks held
desc: The heads of both the International Monetary Fund and European Central Bank have attended talks in Berlin in an attempt to reach a deal with Athens.

title: Canada tobacco firms to pay damages
desc: A Canadian court orders three tobacco companies to pay C$15.5bn (Â£8bn $12bn) - the largest award for damages in the country's history.

title: Anti-IS coalition to discuss action
desc: Ministers from 20 countries are to meet in Paris to discuss strategy against Islamic State militants after the group's latest advances in Iraq.

title: Blatter to attend World Cup final
desc: Fifa president Sepp Blatter will attend the Women's World Cup final in Canada despite the crisis engulfing the governing body.

title: Ex-Lib Dem leader Kennedy dies at 55
desc: Former Liberal Democrat Party leader Charles Kennedy has died at his home in Scotland aged 55 his family says.

title: India cuts rates for a third time
desc: The Reserve Bank of India has cut interest rates for the third time this year to help boost growth in Asia's third largest economy.

title: Aid workers shot dead in north Afghanistan
desc: Nine people including several aid workers are killed in an attack by unknown gunmen in Balkh province northern Afghanistan say officials.

title: Sturgeon warns of EU exit 'backlash'
desc: Scotland's First Minister Nicola Sturgeon warns of a strong backlash if Scotland were to be taken out of the EU by an UK-wide referendum.

title: Virgin-born sawfish found in Florida
desc: Seven sawfish in a Florida estuary become the first virgin-born vertebrates ever found in the wild in a sexually reproducing species.

title: US airport security reforms ordered
desc: A top US official has pledged reforms after tests found that airport screeners allowed mock explosives and weapons through security checkpoints 95% of the time.

title: Slave ship artefacts discovered
desc: Objects recovered from an 18th Century slave ship wrecked off the coast of South Africa are due to be revealed in Cape Town.

desc: The group calling itself Islamic State is using children as young as 12 on the battlefield in the on-going conflict there.

desc: The government in Japan is encouraging a new approach to what people wear at work.

title: Carter seeks calmer waters in S China Sea

desc: Dresden and Nagasaki both have museums to devastating wartime bombing raids - but they adopt very different approaches says Stephen Evans.

title: Hola rocked by botnet accusations
